newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia said likely to buy Indian rice, not wheat.
newsitem.headline: Russia said likely to buy Indian rice, not wheat.

text.p: A delegation of Indian exporters said on Friday they are likely to sell Russia 100,000 tonnes of rice within the next few months, but that obstacles remain to wheat sales.

"We are close to an agreement on sales to Russia of 20,000 tonnes of rice, but our chances are even closer to a total of 100,000 tonnes of rice within the next few months," delegation head Jagmohan Singh Raju told Reuters.
The delegation spent three days in Moscow negotiating possible deals with Russia's Agriculture Ministry and grain merchants.
India last year sold Russia some 230,000 tonnes of rice, but no wheat.
Raju said Russian officials insist that Indian wheat is contaminated with the fungus-like disease karnal bunt.
"We have invited Russian experts to visit our country and see that this disease does not threaten health and to examine storage and transportation facilities," Raju said.
